CY5JK1Fj0eKdoS68OT9sDg.text: Pei Wei is Pei Wei. You love it or you don't. I think their food is pretty decent and they appeal to the masses, even people who are not fans of Asian food seem happy here. Its just good reasonably priced takeout. The Ahwatukee location is actually closer to home but this one is more on my way home so I am happy I finally tried to give it a try. They were super quick with my order, got everything right and very friendly.

ur-eCZtR83XPJz8oOFDuUQ.text: Guessing phone system problems. Decided to do takeout tonight. Called 4 time over a 15 min window. Phone simply rang and rang. No answer on any attempt.

VIbcUSwHIeCD1BhfUflyVQ.text: Getting the sauces substituted is always a game of chance.   Will just stop going can't eat my salads half the time.  This isn't the only location that has done it no matter how hard I break it down it's a fifty fifty shot I will not be eating.

MM3BTVzUIr8Pq2KLKzmK7w.text: I usually love their food but tried the new sushi with mango today and it was one of the worst things I have ever eaten. The quality of the roll was less than something you would expect to get at a convenience store. The mango was almost non-existent and the small piece that I did find was so unripe, it was inedible.  The worst part is that the server that came to our table to remove our plates asked if there was anything wrong with the sushi. I told him it was really terrible and he gave a knowing smile and said that they knew it was bad and that it had not been working out the way they had hoped.  That made me so mad because they know it is bad but they are still selling it to their loyal customers.    Shame on you, Pei Wei.    They are also misleading on their online menu. It says in the description that the rolls are made to order, but I tried to get them without cucumber and was told that I couldn't get it that way because they were pre-made.  Another slap in the face from Pei Wei.

Zth49KZe0qMXwBWQNxydDg.text: The best part about Pei Wei is knowing that everything is absolutely fresh. Veggies are crisp and light, meat is juicy and cooked to order, and rice is cooked well in industrial rice cookers throughout the day and night. All flavors are elevated due to freshness. Doesn't get much better!  I will agree with the bit about inconsistency; I do think this has to do with nothing being pre-cooked, and find the inconsistency to fall on deaf ears since the cuisine is so well though out.

AeeHYfjM3DiATludwmXgWQ.text: I come here for lunch at least once a month & they're always great. The portions are filling, my shrimp, chicken, & wontons are always cooked/fried to perfection & they aren't stingy with vegetables

hO6t_25awa5GtzDbpn2G6Q.text: Another mediocre service experience. We eat here a lot and the service during our last several visits has not been so great. My husband orders the Asian slaw and he always has to ask our server to get it when our food comes. Food always comes many minutes apart so one of us has to wait so we can eat together. Today was my friend's birthday and we ordered lettuce wraps and 2 entrees. Entrees came first (with the wrong rice on one) and lettuce wraps after the entrees. When I mentioned we might have liked our appetizers first, I got a who- cares look from the server. Might not be going back to this location after this.

-pFw12PmaJnc_jzU8JOx4Q.text: Don't get the sushi! It was disgusting!!! Honestly, I'd like my money back. It's basically a giant rice ball with questionable fish. Ahi tuna isn't supposed to be this color... That overwhelming taste of the cheap sea weed wrapper! Ugh!

NYr4qAFF5oYUZiCF69iZyg.text: Spicey Pei Wei By The Rue  I had Pei Wei for lunch today, It wasn't the best dish, Next time I think I'll say, I prefer somewhere with fish.  I got the spicey chicken Pei Wei plate, With brown rice, not white, After ordering it wasn't a long wait, I drank Mello Yellow not Sprite.  The menu said this dish was spicey, But I had to disagree, I added hot mustard to entice me, Oh such a calamity.   Bok chow (The End)

e5G97r27jHmSqIimcHvQbg.text: The food is good, but if you're in a hurry and want to order take-out, don't come here.  Even on nights when there is hardly any one in the place, the service is extremely slow.   The prices are too high for a take-out diner too.  The only saving grace is that if I order the "large" portion, I can get two meals out of it.

qu9saeXYhdO7fnZwc7wlIA.text: I like Pei Wei, I can't put my finger on why. The Kung Pao Chicken Extra spicy is great. I like sitting at the bar to watch all the cooks. Those guys are in the zone when they are back there cooking and its busy. It's a nice medium for me and my daughter, she likes the restaurant next door, I go to Pei Wei and we meet on the patio.

n3KfYtJ1L1U8kEBoXFEyMA.text: Pei Wei is normally delicious. But for some reason this location messes up our order EVERY TIME. They even messed up our replacement order. The manager (if you can get through to him) is great and takes care of us, but having to call and talk to the manager every time you done out is annoying. Just get it right!

tSpeIQhdJLo0f8FXN70D3Q.text: Pei Wei Sunday with the kids is something we do a lot. And this location is the closest. Went there a few Sundays ago, and despite the fact that we go there all the time, it was the last time for sure. The girl at the register was obviously unhappy, and ruined my desire to give this establishment anymore of my money. She should work for the post office, or be a telemarketer. If you hate your job that much, you should look for another one. Management: you should be aware of this, and correct that. Now we are going to the one on Baseline in Gilbert/Mesa, where service; yes, service in a Pei Wei, is very good. They care, they pay attention, they are happy to see and serve you. Anyway, the Wok salad was good, which explains the One star; but bye bye Pei Wei on Guadalupe and Mc Cormick, you will never see me again.

irhHb2rxxgH4uXy43Uciag.text: I have never had problems with any other location except this one. Not only was our food cold but completely gross. We ordered it extra spicy and extra sauce. Both our meals were dry. I'm a vegetarian so I ordered mine with tofu. There were about 5 peices in there. And they put broccoli in which I asked them not to. We ordered a large side of edamame and it wasn't even half full and most of the pods were empty!! This is not a cheap place to eat at and I expected so much better. I did not take it back because my bf is sweet and didn't want to complain. Needless to say I am very disappointed and will not return to this location ever as this is the second time it has happened.

ffqezU9_eX8oiXyIbphrXA.text: Not the best track record of being timely or accurate. I live a mile away and love the food. However, the staff regularly seems to fail to communicate together, orders take quite a while and getting an extra side of sauce always seems like a monumental task. Only leaving review tonight because an online order that said ready at 9 shouldn't be ready 15 mins late when there's two people in the place and at 10 mins late I had to tell the cashier that an order in the hot light looked like ours that'd been there since we arrived lacking one item that she called for to the cooks again and was ready in 5mins. Just can't understand how 3 orders can be so tough to make happen....   Love the food/ wish the people would step it up

BtZ4TVbS_ufWPS3eVtNjtQ.text: I have been here a few times and i really like it!  The place is very clean, including the bathrooms.  Many different choices and always very good. They really do have the beast crab won tons i have ever had.                     A lot of places just put fillers and a lot of won ton. But these are full of crab and very good.  Really good hot tea as well. Very inexpensive place to go. Lots of parking in the lot.

-zZDufBNBgDEJhGsM0zgwA.text: I would like to give a 0 star;(  third time I have gotten home and my order is wrong.  As I waited for my order I observed another customer complaining  about a messed up order. My food was wrong my husband's was right but tasted like kerosine or like a burning chemical taste??? So over it now!!

rrRqevlCQerspAutGHPupg.text: I only gave thus pei Wei 3 stars because the food was good and they have the cool soda fountains.  The customer service was atrocious. The girl who took our order up front barely made eye contact and was eager to end our transaction...even though no one was behind us.   Then the girl who ran our food out asked if we order 6 pot stickers. We did. She placed our plate down, and there were FIVE! She just asked if we ordered 6. When she passed back through we told her we only got five and she brought the other one out. I mean it's not a huge deal. People get busy. Accidents happen. I was just annoyed that she seemed like she couldn't be bothered to get our missing item.   Ughhh. This place. Worst customer service I wish TOTT's would have prevailed in this plaza and not a corporate monster.

Gcs-D57uQSTeiANc7mDi5w.text: I came here one time and it was good, but definitely not my favorite. I ordered to go and had to wait a long time once I got there for my food. Classics are good, but be careful when trying new things.

HGop5PN0zbUD_FLWKFC-kw.text: First of all I would like to say Pei-Wei is a good chain if you compare to the quality of other places of it's kind.  I walked in for lunch, and was surprised that they had brown rice. So I thought I could get a healthy meal, but I was wrong...  I talked to the worker at the front for 5 min, and asked her if there is a healthy (no oily/greasy) style way of making the dish. Unfortunately, we established that there was no way to do this.  Why have the brown rice option if you can't order the dish itself in a healthy way?     I ordered the Pei Wei style chicken, and I waited for the food to come. 15 min later I finally got it. Keep in mind there was no one behind in line, and one person ordering from the "take out" line. I watched  the whole process go down. The main chef put my plate down on the counter in the kitchen, and the "salad chef" was supposed to garnish it with a simple rosemary/parsley addition. That hand off took an extra 7 minutes.... It seemed to me that there was arguing,  and disorderly production behind the counter.  My other complaint would be that the dinner portion which not that large is kinda of pricey.  The plate looks huge when it comes out of the kitchen, but  the Plate comes with 75% rice, and 25% meat so don't be fooled.   Why would you want to eat that kind of protein/carb ratio?    I cannot order the lunch plate because it would not come with enough meat.

Cs5TftNtXCbE24K8q7ag0A.text: The service to this Pei Wei was fine.  The problem came from the taste of the food.  I ordered the Japanese Steak and Shrimp Ramen.  The first thing you will notice is there is no broth.  There is a tiny bit on the bottom but not a significant amount.  Overall there was enough meat and shrimp but for $10  there better be.  The problem with this came from the taste.  It is on the spicy side so if you don't like it spicy you have been warned.  The noodles were a bit on the stiff side.  Kind of reminded me like the type of noodles you would get from a pizza place that had their noodles sitting in the fridge over night.    To cover up for the lack of flavor it looks like they tried to mask it using a spicy red chille sauce.  I have had better tasting top ramen then this dish.  I have had real ramen before and I consider this an insult to my taste buds.  I would have been happy with this dish even with no broth if it tasted good.  My advice is if you want your Mongolian or king pao chicken then you are fine.  If you want a noodle dish I would recommend going to one of the new more authentic ramen places in the Valley.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Tempe, AZ, United States. Japanese Steak and Shrimp Chile ramen.  The shrimp is really small

RhDhyLeWqyt3ccLbklryiw.text: This location used to be the best...it is definitely now the worst!  We recently ordered Mongolian Beef and Kung Pao Chicken.  They tasted exactly the same, just differed meats.  Prepared with same sauce and vegetables.  Terrible!

sMkWjchpVWo2EUYE2ti8cg.text: Very rarely do I pick up an order at this location that isn't messed up. The staff is almost rude about it when I have to come back and tell them that my order is incorrect.

yINStGwtsOwVZ9voe5OePw.text: I received a coupon from Pei Wei yesterday for 33% off of Rice, Noodle and Salad Bowls. I gave the coupon to the cashier before placing the order. When the order was rung up, it wasn't giving me the correct discount. The cashier argued with me at first that I was receiving the discount, but the math wasn't adding up. The items on the ticket matched the coupon and, it wasn't working. She asked if she should go to the manager, and I said yes. I was only coming to Pei Wei today because of the 33% off. That's a great discount!   The manager was very snotty about the situation. He refused to come to speak with me and kept saying, "I have no control over that. I don't issue the coupons. Corporate does." He said that 3 times. Then, he said, "if you want to give her a 25% discount, do it". I had a coupon that stated I should receive 33% off. The cashier came back and repeated what he said and said "I can give you a 25% discount, if you want". Why in the world would I want a 25% discount if I have a coupon from Pei Wei offering 33% off? I told them to cancel my order and I won't be back. The manager's attitude was appalling! If corporate Pei Wei offers 33% off, you are still responsible to honor it. The coupon didn't say, "well, hey, if the manager of a Pei Wei doesn't issue the coupon and corporate does, be prepared for 25% off." It said 33% off!  There was a way that the manager could have handled this correctly. He could have offered something that made up the difference like a free little appetizer or anything, but he made no attempt to fix the issue and acted very exasperated as if I should be ashamed of myself for expecting them to honor the coupon. Seriously???   I've been a customer of Pei Wei for more than a decade. I WILL NOT BE BACK. This was some of the worst customer service I have ever received. The manager really needs to learn customer service and maybe take some anger management classes.

9TSwcfgCVD2kq8DGs65Y1w.text: This place has hit rock bottom. They used to have an excellent manager, however I haven't seen him in ages!   Today I went to pick up my order. There were two other customers sitting together at a table. The rest of the restaurant was empty. I stood at the pick up station for 10 minutes while three staff members looked directly at me and continued to ignore me. Finally, one worker came over and was very confused about my order even though it was already sitting on the table since before I arrived. She told me the total was $18.36 which matched my online emailed receipt. I paid her with a $20. She then freaks out when as I'm waiting for my change and says she pressed that I gave her $40 when I gave her $20. She yells for the manager about three times. On the third time the manager finally looks over and tells her to wait. The manager eventually makes it over to us and proceeds to be rude to me and says that my total is $20.65. I said "no, my online order is $18.36, and the young lady had even rang me up for that total." The manager replies "that's not what it says on our end, you owe us another .65 cents"  I was frustrated beyond words. I am shocked a manager would act in such a manner and make a mistake like this!Rather than exchange angry words, I just turned around and left quietly. What's happened to this peiwei? It used to be one of the best.

svg_qdBYgc_-aEJBHWQE9g.text: Every time we order food Togo from here there is always something wrong. It's either the chicken is nasty tasting or the noodles were bad. Let just say the noodles were like reheated Ramon, very sad.  Every other Pei Wei we go to no problems. But here I can remember at least 6 times. Usually we are in a hurry with kids so we get it to go but tonight we actually had time so we dined in. From the moment we walked in we already felt a bad vibe. It looked like the cooks were about to go at it and the cashier was trying to be clam about it.  So we ordered our food we wait with the kids and then it's taking awhile. We noticed there were no cooks cooking then Tempe fire dept comes with there crew code 3  with tools  and medical  equipment. The first thing I thought was they mush have a had a fight that went south. But I believe someone got injured on the equipment in the back who knows how but Fire was there for a long while. After 45min my wife went back up there to get a refund. It was a pain in the butt but it seems like we never have any good luck here. It seems like the cashiers here are always stress and they are understaffed with the amount of people coming in.  We always see people complaining about how their food is wrong or price while waiting to pick up their meal.  Not to mention we always here were out of this or that.  Sounds like it's a management problem to me.

ddp4MKw_eHA9DKLdnqQ3sw.text: I'm not sure why I need to write this review on my wife's phone, why it's so unheard of to write more then one review on a restaurant on Yelp. I don't want to update my review on Guadalupe Pei Wei, I want to write another review so users can see how consistently bad the restaurant is. Anyhow, this Pei Wei stunk it up again. I ordered Spring Rolls and they came without sauce. What the heck's a spring roll without the sweet sauce? My wife's ahi avocado salad didn't come with crunchy wontons. NO CUNCH! This place is severely challenged. I think the new manager hires clueless workers so he comes off as competent in comparison. Why do I go back? What is the matter with me? Soon, I'll get my pre-written apology from Pei Wei that doesn't even work properly when you try to respond to manager, who must be the most clueless person in the building.

-WoPmP2NbUW7BVxvBNASNg.text: I live right next to this location and it's terrible. I've been there 5 times and each time there was something wrong with the food or it was just gross tasting (not fresh at all). Equally, there seems to regularly be super long lines and crazy 20-30 minute wait times after your order for food to cook. Go somewhere else... almost anywhere else.

WxRmrRQjRvg-mLjTO0gTrw.text: They somehow manage to mess up my order every single time! And I don't do special orders! Regular menu stuff! Food is never consistent either! I think the kitchen staff is what's wrong with this place! And management for not making sure its staff is well trained!

6biE-kECbKXtqf3fTf6hqw.text: Went to the restaurant tonight to place a take out order..signs up everywhere for orange chicken, so decided to order it. Got it home and was so underwhelmed. Mushy, cold, tasteless, no vegetables, very little sauce. This was the worst food experience I've ever had at pei wei. Gross. Meh. No thanks. Waste of time and money. A truly disappointing dinner that ended up in the trash.

tSlrzR8fIF0hURPcxrfNnw.text: Five for dinner.  One kids meal, one edamame,  one lettuce wrap, one cup of spicy soup, one adult meal, two sushi.  25 minutes later,  comes the sushi. 15 minutes later, lettuce wrap and cup of soup, 10 minutes later edamame.  20 minutes later we had to ask for the kids meal and adult meal to go. The spicy soup had to be sent back as it was flavored broth no spice.  Had we remained in the restaurant,  the adult meal would have gone back.  Ugh! Done.  When we asked about the last two meals we were told...." we were just talking about that"!  DONE! POOR Management, food was bad.  The manager was on the fryer and referred me to the Asst. Manager.

1Zn98inUJ6AxgoImFFnclw.text: What would be really great is that when you tell them you are a vegetarian or a vegan and you order something that happens to have animal products in it (chicken broth) that they would tell you this information. Got sick.  Won't be back.

bzYorZjeWOYTYP6CBk0e-A.text: The food is great; however, the reason for my poor review is because I was in this location about a week or two ago, and I ordered food to eat there, and after ordering, a huge party came in behind me and ordered their food, along with some other stragglers. The guy who took my order forgot to give me a table number, and so the waitress accidentally gave my food to someone else. The giant party and everyone else who ordered after me got their food before I got mine, and I ended up waiting 40 minutes for 1 thing. I was with my boyfriend chatting otherwise I would have complained sooner. Once I brought this to the attention of the food runner, she was like, "oh whoops I gave your food to someone else. Sorry". My food then came out promptly, but really? That's it? Sorry?? Like if the guy forgot to give me a table number then he should have run after me with one, or told the food runner that I was the customer who didn't have a number. I was already having a long day and was really hungry. It just seemed rude not to care that I didn't get my order of one item for over half an hour.

EY_WNlnVVWMl7fd9j2-wyA.text: Hate to do this because this is my favorite spot to eat... Ordered my food to go. It was somewhat busy, but not too bad. I knew there would be a wait so I waited patiently for my food. It took 40 min before I went up and asked if my food was ready. The girl who took my order said they called my name 3 times but I didn't hear anything. And mind you, I was sitting near the order desk and in clear sight. Very disappointed in the service today. Would've expected a little more from this place, especially when I go on my lunch break. The food is great, but I'm not so sure about the service anymore.

EIDgjP20ftYqE8Eh9ETYbg.text: Service was decent but I ordered orange chicken not white rice as my entree. Literally more than 3/4 of my food was white rice. Really disappointed

My order was not correct, yet I could not get through via phone to discuss the matter and it was mediocre in flavor/taste!

Same reoccurring issue, a plate (or a bowl when it comes to the kids meal) full of rice with very little protein. Disappointing as we really did like chain. Today, they weren't super busy I still had to wait a few minutes for my food, but I get home and the food smells and tastes burnt. Not as enjoyable as it usually is. Not sure if I'll be going back.

yG5ajQ67jOn7dvVR0hVHBg.text: Hi I came in earlier today and ordered thai dynamite with tofu and noodles and kung pao with vegetables and tofu.  When I received the dish i got it with meat in it and told the waitress that I ordered it with tofu not chicken because i am a vegetarian.  so she took it back and said they will remake it with tofu and brought me a new dish so I start eating it and then found a piece of chicken in it.  I disregarded it and threw that out and packed up the rest because I lost my appetite and thought it was only one piece, So I went to work after and decided to eat the leftovers for dinner and I found 6 more pieces of chicken in the dish!! This infuriates me because I ordered the dish paid extra for the noodles and everything and they made it wrong and just took the chicken off the top and added tofu to it.  They did not remake the dish and clearly did not care about customer service or anything. They were to cheap and lazy to get a new plate out, add fresh noodles and then add the remade tofu on top. I paid extra for the noodles anyways but I was not able to get the right dish and the staff was inconsiderate.

GnwENUH_SmmOZzn-LE4a7w.text: Took more than 30 minutes to get our food for a party of two. All the food items came at different times and some were 20 minutes apart. Food quality was fair not as good as it use to be. Probably won't go back unless I see much better reviews.

MX4DLXdytX1HLXcGp_T56w.text: Don't bother ordering online, unless you have an extra half hour to wait after your order is supposed to be ready. Unacceptable.

UcAfCLl9424d3ZwyvDgAlQ.text: Pei Wei was always my answer to the question, "What's your favorite local restaurant?" In the last year or so... that is no longer the case. It might just be the management at this particular Pei Wei, but the food doesn't seem as fresh, The dishes are filthy as in they aren't washed properly, the tables are dirty and there is trash on the floor, there's hardly anyone that dines in anymore at this particular joint, and most importantly, and most unfortunate, is that the service is now horrible. I know it's a generational thing, but the people who help at the front counter are no longer kind, or respectable, and they don't seem to care about it one bit.

fZjBT962TrUb-y23Ak9iTw.text: Throughly enjoyed coming to Pei Wei on a Monday night but the experience would have been much better for me if they didn't run out of sushi. I did end up getting the honey chicken bowl and it was a better alternative to Panda Express. I don't enjoy greasy food very much and Pei Wei did not disappoint on that part. Overall, the atmosphere was great, the food was good and I do recommend it if you enjoy Asian cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Tempe, AZ, United States

XYzKQ5pM2lTls7EzLfv9PQ.text: I use to go here regularly but after the last 2 times of food being burned--the peanuts in one dish were actually black and most of the meat and veggies in the others were also so over cooked as to be inedible--I and my coworkers who used to enjoy our takeout lunches from here no longer want to throw away our money. I went to another Pei Wei in Ahwatukee and also found the quality is well below what it use to be. I hope they can fix these issues because I'm not coming back until they do.

a2KoFAPKVCu2-M69DpWraQ.text: Been eating at this location for many years, but it's apparent something is going very wrong here.  I've noticed several very troubling reviews as of late, but since I had not personally had a bad experience it didn't prevent me from going back.  Until tonight.  Placed a $32 online order and waited 30 minutes to go pickup.  The moment we walked in the door it was obvious something was very wrong.  Very few people in the restaurant, but there were at least 12 tables uncleaned and covered in dirty dishes.  The fountain drink machine was empty on multiple drink selections, the wonton cookie bin was empty on the self service area, the cashier was telling customers there would be at least a 15-20 minute wait for their food.  The restaurant was clearly understaffed with one cashier for dine in and take out, one cook, and a couple people walking in and out of the back.  MOST concerning was that nobody seemed to really care.  We waited for 45 minutes and in that time not a single item from our "take out" order was ever prepared.  The cashier started turning guests away, and finally put a sign on the door saying they were no longer taking any orders.  They started calling customers that had placed online orders and telling them they wouldn't be able to make the food.  It was only 6:30pm on a Sunday night and the cook just started shutting down the kitchen.  After 45 minutes of seeing a situation go from bad to worse, it was apparent we weren't going to get ANY of the food we paid for.  So, I asked the cashier if I could just get a refund.  He promised that he would cancel my order and I would receive a credit to my card.  Hope he's right.  Multiple other guests who had been waiting on their food started to give up as well.  I suspect they just closed the entire restaurant by around 7pm.  These events are just too significant to ignore so I won't be returning.  I hope they can't things back on track.

vcTZjiWZ6-sqWF8oeJ0Evw.text: I enjoy the lettuce wraps, dan dan noodles and Mongolian beef. It's fast food American/Chinese food. It's not authentic but it's tasty, efficient and typical very clean. I do love the soda machines. There are a lot of options in soda and I'm able to get diet Vanilla Coke. Thumbs up there.

KXFAMm1DVgzFPAk5C8j5xA.text: Ugh so frustrated with this place!! You should tell people when they are ordering the signature dish that they don't have the breading for the orange chicken!! You don't let them order, wait, then have them set it in front of you wondering what the heck you just ordered!! Also the brown rice was so dry.

uWRCGISRhbdBOkCz4cp4tA.text: My favorite while living in Phoenix is the original chicken lettuce wrap.  I'd def pass on the Thai chicken lettuce wrap.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Tempe, AZ, United States. The Thai lettuce wrap.  I recommend the chicken lettuce wrap.

Ye0NZnD7hGlURXjC2dyXjQ.text: I ordered over the phone and the nice young man (wish I would've caught his name!) was so polite and helpful. I go in a half hour later to pick it up in the middle of their lunch rush. The same guy who answered the phone was there taking orders and bagging up to go orders. He was fast and efficient and was working his butt off being the only one at the registers helping all these people! The food is always amazing but the service was impeccable today!

z3_MIMnQ1ml-3jh2YG73OQ.text: Seriously, such ridiculously stupid service. Every. Single. Time. My order is messed up, I'm overcharged, it takes forever. I keep coming back because I like having their cauliflower rice as an option. Today, I stupidly waited 20 minutes in line (because the young woman is really slow and I know this), only to find that they literally have no cauliflower rice and have been having this problem for a while. And instead of telling the ridiculously long line that they're out? They just wait until each of us get to the front and say, "yeah, lots of people are upset."

eTmb-bfwap-cIFlkAdhuJA.text: VERY disapointed.  Did take out, got home and i could not believe the skimpy amount of meat in my meal.  I have never done this but i took out my scale and weighed the meat.  2.3 ounces.  If I could post s pic I would.  I could hardly even see the meat.. certainly nothing like the pictures they advertise .  ugh.. wont go back here

6SLy2AVX52Y2E1EhszcLYQ.text: Weird that there are quite a few haters of this place.   We had a really good meal that was actually made when you order it and have lots of customizations that would never happen correctly at 99% if other Asian food restaurants.  The difference between here and panda is not even comparable- yet the price is about the same.   We even messed up and ordered fried shrimp rather than steamed - they were super nice and brought out seamed shrimp for no charge!  Btw both the fried and steamed shrimp are gluten free!  Great service, open kitchen so no funny business- what more do ya want?

3vhCvroyfuEwvLSJJAwozg.text: gave me no vegetables or sauce on a noodle bowl, didn't even fry my wontons. such a sad experience

HReuJmm7JmGCWYBpvnta4Q.text: Food is good, staff super rude. I questioned waiter why my main course came before my appetizer and he said several times,"we have to make your appetizer and it's not done." He said it so matter of factly like that makes perfect sense. You can't get your appetizer first if it's not made. Umm, hello, appetizers come first, hence the name. This teenager was so rude he should be fired!

Yu44JjoWREKtXndLWI78dQ.text: This location has terrible staff. They can't even manage to answer the phone. If it is that busy there you may want to consider hiring more people. You are losing business.

8mzV-hpVj3SAR76s7WX74g.text: Clean atmosphere. Always tastes great.  I get the pei Wei spicey chicken with fried rice no veggies extra egg. Few cents over 10$ but I'm always full. Good service, quick, and I always get a to go cup for my water.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Tempe, AZ, United States. Wasabi crunch roll. Yummy
Photo of Pei Wei - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pei Wei spicey fried rice

y6iC2HkZvOX-E5v1GDIu4w.text: I called in to Pei Wei to get take out tonight and the phone was answered by a boy named Dylan. Dylan had a horrible attitude and was not customer service oriented. I was almost going to cancel my order but I changed my mind because I didn't want to waste food. I'm going to avoid this location as much as possible. If he's able to talk to customers like that and it flys by management then I'd rather take my business next door where they are always respectful and extremely friendly.

DzL_35fY4BDQc8osvge3mA.text: First time eating here because the rating on the prices were said to be different than Panda Express. They seem to be about the same price when you order your drink and additional sides. It may be a bit more.   My interaction with the cashier was very pleasant. She was very helpful helping me decide on what to order. I was on a budget trying to decide what to get and I'm surprised she did not give me any attitude with the remarks I made about the constant changes I made trying to deal with my price range.  The service seemed to be okay. The manager seemed to be bringing everyone there meals. I had a question about the types of chili to have with my meal so I see one of the guys in the black uniforms who I noticed delivered some of the food out to the guests.  I look over at him and he notices me staring. I was hoping he would come up to me and help me out with finding some siracha because with Pei Wei being an asian restaurant I was hoping they would have some. He then turns away from me so I have to walk all the way to the counter to ask him if they had any. He answers my question very rudely and turned away.  It made me feel pretty stupid asking a question like that but then again it made me quite angry. I walked away and did nothing about it.   Every person interacting with a guest should be willing to help them out with any questions they have. If it weren't for the helpful cashier I would have given a one star rating.  Food was actually really good as well.

qgLxYzwbQ8dpwIJVPB_mQg.text: After driving around for awhile to find a place to eat without a wait, I ended up at pei Wei with James C.  I discovered that they revamped the menu entirely. Now you pick a protein and a sauce. No more combos :(  I decided to have chicken with spicy Korean sauce and brown rice. We also shared an order of lettuce wraps. Lettuce wraps were as expected. My dish came out and it didn't look like what I expected, but I was hopeful and waited until James got his to dig in. I took a bite of the chicken and whatever flavoring was nonexistent. It was not spicy and really had no taste. I added some soy sauce to the brown rice and for brown rice, it didn't taste good either. I ended up taking just a few bites and leaving the rest. I will reluctantly give them a second chance since I did try something new, but I really wouldn't recommend what I got to anyone.

KALu8vv5Nkh6H9BC83qMeA.text: I was looking for something light for dinner after shopping at the Trader Joe's across the street. I stopped here and ordered the Korean steak lettuce wraps. I was expecting small strips of steak with a spicy sauce and some veggies and a stack of iceberg lettuce to wrap the filling with. The first surprise was that the beef was just coarsely ground meat, not strips of beef. The second surprise was the sauce. It was not spicy, but it was oily. The veggies did seem fresh. The portion was just right for a light dinner and was a little over $8 with tax.   The ordering process was odd. You stand in a line and place your order with a person behind a counter (not intuitive since the cash registers are not visible). The take-out area is part of the same section of counter, so it feels confusing and cluttered with people milling around waiting for take-out while other people are placing their orders. The kitchen is open and once you place your order you are supposed to figure out where to go next. I walked into the open dining area to look for a table and stopped by the soda station to get a glass of water. I couldn't find the napkins. I found a table and put my number on the table. A young man brought my food to the table once it was ready and got me some napkins (it turns out they were toward the back of the soda station). When I was done I couldn't figure out where to put my trash and plate. I watched for a few minutes and looks like they have staff to bus the tables. So this seems to be some hybrid between fast food self-serve and a sit-down restaurant.  The place seems clean. The staff was polite but I never saw a smile nor welcoming word from anyone. Parking is close to the door. I'm not sure there is anything here to prompt me to return.

NFlILc1be8gupo6_CivRxQ.text: The best fast-food style pan-asian cuisine in town. But the quality is really fresh. Everything is fried/cooked made to order so you do have to wait but dishes are piping hot!!  You order at the front and they give you a number that you take to your table. Most dishes for lunch average around $8.00  My favorite dish is the Mongolian dish (options of beef, chicken, shrimp or tofu).   They have a new soda pop machine that is really HIGH-tech! The orange-citrus tea isn't so great. But they have fortune cookies in the middle of the condiments corner that aren't stale!!

3cpZJiGpzPKHnDC6LflF4A.text: I've always had a satisfactory experience at this location. The only exception is when I've branched out and tried their sushi. It's strange that they're packaging includes a sticker to inform the customer to store the sushi at a particular temperature, but every time I've ordered the sushi, they package it on top of hot food, so by the time I pick it up the sushi is warm. Last time I ordered it, I just threw it away fearing food poisoning. So in other words, stick to the regular menu items.

TCghrbv4_Svd6P3dwEg3OA.text: My husband and I ordered Pei Wei through the our delivery app. My husband got the lettuce wraps (you really can't go wrong with those) and I ordered the steak Pad Thai with just a touch of spicy. It was DELICIOUS. My Pad Thai was a little spicer than I thought it would be but I can handle spice. It was delicious. I am always craving it! Favorite place!

uCXpm_hJHa_rzllWHhaqiQ.text: I know I have reviewed this location before. However, I do really like it. So here is another one. It seems that they have fully redone all their Staff. OK that is why they were closed for awhile.  Anyway, we got a great coupon for and entree. So I called in the order for pick up. When I got there I added on the Crab Puffs. We have always really liked them here, they sure seem like they have real crab in them. So there you go. This time around we ordered Kung Pao chicken which was very good, with lovely crisp snow peas. As well as Sweet and Sour Chicken several sauses on the side. It was hot and fresh. Very good as always. We were extra Greatful for the coupon as well. Everything is still nice and clean inside. But, I took it to go.

lhNVQJ8srnhyIZawQWmDlA.text: I really like this particular Pei Wei as it easy to get into and I find it isn't as busy as the other locations.  I typically order the Honey Seared Chicken and it's always fantastic though they could cut the rice in half and give me another piece of chicken, as I always throw about 3/4 of the rice away, it's just too much.  My only reason for the 4 star instead of a 5 star?  When you're sitting at the tables it's like being in a wind tunnel, the last two times I've been in it was chilly outside and I FROZE in there.  I have witnessed many people picking a table and then having to get up and move to another spot when someone leaves as the "warm" tables are always taken when you go in.

AX-y-JvBK8C6fVvfoItQyw.text: Went there today. Pretty good. Experience was disappointing because one person in our group of four didn't get his meal until the rest of us were almost done eating. His dish was the same as another in our group. They must have just forgot or messed up the order

85eVP3ks7-AxQbCe0th22A.text: I like that location. Anytime I ordered by phone they are very nice . Pei Wei is my second kitchen. My favorite are Kung Pao Shrimp and noodles

SRXOXkAqYYE03YJUbC0ChQ.text: Hate ordering new dishes, maybe the cooks don't know how to make it.  I ordered the Bangkok peanut noodles, take out.  Got it home, no peanut garnish, no lime, no ginger taste, the tofu was dried and hard.  The cook should have hydrated the tofu, the dish was tasteless and a waste of money....threw 3/4 of the dish in the trash.  Either train the cooks or its time to find another place to eat.

iTq4DWSCQl6UX9_2rgYW5w.text: DISAPPOINTED....first they got my order wrong...second the pot stickers were so over friend we could not finish them...what about standards? Who let that leave the kitchen? Third...Spring rolls, veggie came fried to a crisp. My bad I guess. I expected soft unfriend spring rolls which is how they should be served especially when fried egg rolls are offered as well. They were way over cooked. Somebody needs so fryer training!  The restaurant was not busy at the time. This is just sloppy food prep. As for the sushi...very average at best.  1) The California mango roll...don't waste your time. The mango cannot be tasted nor seen. We did not order this but we got it and paid for it. 2) All 4 rolls were different in size. Consistency is the key to good food prep. Why the disparity of sizes? 3) The crunch rolls (2) were the best of what we got and they are on a limited basis... We spent $37 on dinner for two and they served us cheap plastic cutlery. Very disappointed. If you are going to advertise your food as upscale your accoutrements should be as well.  Overall a very disappointing experience and I will not go back. I bought into all the hype in marketing and advertising...I would have preferred a better more professionally prepared meal. I don't think there was anyone in the kitchen over 21 years old...high turnover? In any case better training is needed.

WatByF4LU04MkMu9Y7Eigg.text: I only came here because my coworkers wanted to come. The food is flavorless, yet spicy. And although I love spicy foods, I hate that they use it to attempt to hide the fact that the food is so bland.

yclXCihvsowlW3s6w17K8Q.text: Love this location! We came in here around 9:15 right before closing time, they treated us like it was any other part of the day (unlike most places when you come in right before closing). When we were sitting around eating they came to our table to make sure we weren't drinking iced tea before they took apart the machine. Great food, great service!

BXdtbQ9q-ia_AXdQXXOO9A.text: Note to staff and management, maybe don't package hot food with sushi for take out orders, leaving hot food containers with/on top of the sushi while the order is all bagged up and waiting for pickup.  This has happened to us the last two times ordering take out, leading us to throw out the sushi.

QUFTIz6IN4dV0R1oMhtSCA.text: I like coming to Pei Wei for their Honey Seared entrees. The quality of their chicken is good. The tofu is delicious but it can seem too greasy at times. My only issue is that they give an immense portion of rice. It's not MUST HAVE Asian food, but it something that is definitely satisfying when you're craving Asian flavors. A great alternative to Panda Express. Their sushi is so-so.

iUbvt_-aMPb3h464e8G5gg.text: My noodles where flavorless as there was no sauce on my food. I ordered shrimp with teriyaki noodles.  The shrimp was delicious and had great flavor. My son ordered the same thing except the kid version and his noodles were a completely different color because he had teriyaki sauce in his! I asked for some more sauce. I was told sure no problem. I sat for about 10-15 min while my noodles got cold. Still no sauce. The server I asked had run to the bathroom and was in there for about a good 15-20 min. Before he came out I asked someone else. Same thing they said, no problem I'll bring it to you. Still no sauce. So I ate my cold noodles and left.

kZxV89x7_3R_BdFGKVCQcQ.text: Overcooked syrupy sweet chinese food tastes un fresh like it was plated from a cut rate buffet.

zW_p7Wz_bn1zgKbASVZ2Iw.text: Ordered today as I'm always do didn't look too busy after 45 minutes of my order the food wasn't ready  I left without eating  Pei Wei stuff it's easier to say we have a problem today the wait will be longer then usual.  Too bad I really liked the food but I cannot waist 1 hour for lunch

NtKyZqv0l1jwrXxnTE44xQ.text: My son tried "sushi" here for the first time! Very cool they had it on the menu. My kid goes with honey seared chickenso yummy. I typically stick to pad Thai or Kung pao chicken. Edemame's and lettuce wraps are to die for. Casual ambiance but nice:)

AzQSEKpXkITFXhVv2_edDA.text: I love Pei Wei. The service is always awesome. But come on, who does the food orders for this store? It's a busy store and they are ALWAYS out of MULTIPLE menu items. Mega lame.

4T8LaYPsB12k8G4CW2T-kw.text: Please just don't waste your time, or money here. It's trash.   Made an order online at 8pm, arrive at 8:30pm to pick it up only to be told that they don't have sushi. Rest of the food was gross, the rice bowls had very low portions of protein, but tons of old stale rice to make up for it.   You should just eat out of the trash can outside, at least you'd get your money's worth.

dir69lfkuEkJ0h5FE1vEUA.text: Pei Wei is a staple in my family. We order from this location at least twice a month. No disappointments here.  Last time I stopped by, I ate at the bar since I was alone and I was offered more food for free. Yay!

Tz6jhgXUjCt8E-nvMQ_CUA.text: I came in at 3:10 and ordered lunch. I left at 4 o'clock and left with nothing. The person who took my order was mice- but the kitchen was all messed up. Get your ish together! check out shu sushi down the road. Way better!

EsdWhqDfPBZfNDp5zyBF1Q.text: It's not bad, its not great.    I've ate here 3 or 4 times trying to get a feel for this place.    I got the chicken pad Thai twice, and the Mongolian once.   It's uh.... ok.     As far as Pad Thai goes, it just lacked flavor.    I've had better.   the noodles were over cooked and the chicken was not great.      I've kinda avoided this place when it shows up on the work delivery menu.

4bXiG8Ha9o_x-tvVfi5n4w.text: Food is cooked in a rush sometimes with added items to your meal cold (ie: brocolli) and last 3 times I been here it's taken over 45minutes to recieve my meal. Go here if u have a lot of time of your hands but if your on your lunch break like most people are around this area just pick somewhere else.

289gwFwK9ILTmers6iI3DQ.text: We have had good experiences at this Pei Wei for years, but no longer. There has been a sudden decline in the quality of the space, food, and employees. Now, the restaurant is filthy, the staff is unprofessional, and the food is subpar.

qhvpc8SLuF_KYN31nXhwQg.text: If I could give ZERO  I would! The worst Asian food I have ever had. I tried it for the 2nd time today, thinking the first time was a fluke.  NOPE. NEVER.AGAIN!

MFf9y0W1gUc6E-74p2QOzA.text: This only applies to this specific location of Pei Wei. Guadalupe/McClintock. The food is the food. Big chains rarely mess up food. But this place some how finds a way.   Had take out order. Two Mongolian and two honey seared. Both meats tasted off. Not spoiled but just as if they were sitting for too long. In addition they were very stingy with the sauce. The honey seared chicken was just fried chicken. The mongol beef was just pan seared beef.   I will drive the extra distance for another Pei Wei.

1CIl6r25FyeLADimv-gpIw.text: Terrible performance from a chain I like so much.  After placing my order online, and scheduling it for a little later today, I showed up. I was a couple minutes early so I expected to wait a minute or two.   The cashier tells me he will bag my order up right away and turns around. I'm waiting and see what I think to be my entree and he then proceeds to do some expo work putting other orders together.   "Okay, its dinner time surely there are other orders and he's just about to get to mine!" Nope.... After about 5 min of waiting at the register I decide to take a seat just as the cashier finally turns back around. "Perfect, he's got it ready and I can get out of here because I'm already running late!" Nope.... He walks straight passed me.  So I sit down again and start waiting..... and waiting. Not a word from cashier or another employee who may have been the manager.   10 min later, as I finally stand up to ask where my food is the cashier walks right past me again. Fortunately, he comes back with a box that turns out to be part of my order!  Finally, he starts bagging my order and he does what I was really hoping he wouldn't.... That entree that was sitting on the counter, away from any source of heat, is in fact mine, and it's been sitting there longer than I have at this point.  Cashier hands me my order and tells me to have a good night. Well, it's not off to a good start...   I get back to the office and am finally ready to enjoy some good food (if not a little cold) from a place I always love! Nope...  Chicken Chow Mein; Boiled noodles lacking any type of a sauce piled on top of veggies (carrots, onion, spinach & garlic). Now I get it, it's been at least 30min since this came out of the wok so temperature is nobody's fault. BUT! The veggies were next to raw. I don't mean cold. The spinach hadn't even wilted! Maybe they spent a couple seconds in the wok. Extra fun when you find ground garlic, an ingredient generally mixed throughout the dish to season (at least that's what any cook has ever told me), in a single pile, and again completely RAW!  If this is some new concept where I pay a place for the ingredients and then take them home to cook them please let me know!  The chicken had the opposite problem. Seemed pretty clear it had been cooked before being cooked again (or warmed up) for my meal. Dry, tough, unseasoned, just like everyone does not like it!  Fortunately, the egg rolls (the ones that took an extra 10 min to cook after I showed up) were decent at best, but I guess it's tough to mess up something that comes to the store frozen.  I get it! I've spent plenty of time in the restaurant industry to know not every meal or experience is perfect, but you have to at least put in the effort to attempt to make it that way! I'm not mad. I'm just very disappointed.  Hopefully, this place turns it around. Certainly by the looks of this place now that I check the Yelp scores it seems there are many issues to be fixed and I am not the first complaint.  Hopefully I hear something from somebody that gives me some hope about this place.

XdU2t2XeEAzR78-GUei2WA.text: I wish I could leave fewer stars. This experience has the potential to be one of my worst dining experiences to date. I placed an order for 2 people and was told it would take 10-15 minutes as it was lunch time and a bit busy. It ended up taking 40 minutes and I only got my food when I requested a refund because we no longer had time to eat during our lunch break. Not only did it take forever but the food was absolutely, horrifically terrible. Horrible experience, stay away.

3n-oQB2VcktJcZ_XIhakiQ.text: We hadn't had Pei Wei for a while due to a bad experience.  Well I decided we'd give it a try so I placed on online order for my family of 4 and did I regret it! Orders were wrong no veggies in a couple of the dishes, chicken was gummy at best and the lettuce wrap filling was burnt as soon as we opened the box all you could smell was burnt chicken. It was horrible. I wouldn't recommend this location to anyone.

nsiCnitMu9ktoPWFadQ3xw.text: So, I'm not sure why ordering online causes problems for this restaurant.  1) my confirmation does not show my entire order (no big deal if the rest was ok) 2)when I pay extra for a "regular" size bowl, and my wife orders a small you would expect them to be different sizes. Don't pay the extra $4 it's exactly the same size.  3)when you show up after calling to make sure the confirmation email was wrong and are assured the rest of your order is on the ticket and is read back to you, it's infuriating to arrive and find they only show an appetizer in their system, reorder and wait for them to make it 4)kids meals are a joke, 3 pieces of chicken crammed in a small box full of noodles  The advertising campaign about orange chicken is laughable, Panda Express is better in so many ways. Which is sad because Pei Wei and this location used to be good. How can a "fast food" place like Panda Express be Pei Wei's prime competition?

Tler-Nx9xho_2l0_rb3ynw.text: If you are gluten free, BEWARE!  Do not be fooled by the gluten free menu.  There have been a number of gluten free diners who have gotten ill after eating here, and at least two (that I know of) who believe they have been served gluten after ordering gluten free.  If a restaurant is going to offer a gluten free menu, then they need to ensure that their staff is trained.  They need to show clear evidence of cross contamination procedures.  Our family used to eat here regularly and we finally gave up.  It wasn't safe for us.   We now eat at Tott's, which doesn't have a gf menu, but has been very accommodating.

OOMMjlnP6NF8o72qbSMJpg.text: The hot and sour soup was just plain awful.  The soup was cold, and the base tasted like burnt mushrooms.  The dan dan noodles are without a doubt one of the worst things I've ever eaten -- mushy noodles with a sauce sweet enough for pancakes.  Never again.  This place sucks!

avCvOp6d6s6i-rgCQnPkkg.text: Good stuff. Mowed down some Korean chicken. I like my stuff spicey so I douse it with the chili sauce. Can't go wrong here really. Always a pretty good back up place when no one can decide where to get lunch. The "view" here is usually great too, if you know what I mean. BOOOO YA!!!

mivrzjWNGfQMknWYDAAigg.text: Good and consistent for a chain. Never can go wrong with the food.

T62-T8_W-YUoq-i4gUbNCg.text: Ever since I was little I have loved Asian food and Pei Wei always brings me back to my childhood. Great hospitality when you order. If you don't know what you want they can help you create a dish that is just right for you! You get a lot of food for cheap and being in college that is great. I always try something different when I go there and am always taken back on how amazing the food is.

TSV4L6XRSfgI0l1HoUw-aw.text: The food is decent, but not for the price.  In the same complex you can get much better and more food for the same price or cheaper at Totts Asian Diner.

qBSbphUMdBCJFCpd6D8Cfg.text: On a whim, me and my wife decided to try out Pei Wei and for me it was one of the worst experiences I have had food wise at this chain. The food was less than mediocre. My meal (Honey Seared Chicken) was lukewarm and it tasted as if it had been sitting under a heating lamp for some time. The food itself lacked flavor all around. Save yourself some money and go to Tott's Asian Diner across the parking lot for much better food and better prices.

SNnT-BatfSCj6afcceShdA.text: i've eaten at several pei wei restaurants -- which are all about the same -- but i've chosen to review this one, because it's special for a couple of reasons:  - it's closest to my home - it was after a lunch meal here that i decided i would be plenty happy if i never eat at pei wei again  this is my fifth review on yelp, and it's my first review of a chain.  there's a good reason for that -- i spend much more time and money at mom and pop stores than chains.  there's nothing wrong with pei wei -- but there's nothing really right about it either.  the recipes are solid, but the ingredients are average.  the service is acceptable, but you know nobody really cares.  the decor is cool at first glance, but it lacks depth and character.  all of the pei wei pieces are right, but when you put it all together you still end up with an impersonal chain restaurant that's nothing more than a series of business decisions, by committee.  ok.  with that said...if you've never been to pei wei, you should probably give it a try.  i'm no fan of chains, but these guys pull it off much better than most other cookie-cutter eateries. you'll probably enjoy at least your first 1/2 dozen or so experiences. the lettuce wraps, spicy korean, and blazing noodles used to be favorites of mine.  so there's another reason why i picked this location to review...it's also right next to Tott's, which is everything i imagine pei wei would be if it wasn't a huge corporation, was run by a hand-picked staff, and was paying someone's mortgage.  it's an excellent example of why privately owned, mom and pop, and smaller, can be so much better.  just try the bourbon chicken there and see if you ever go back to pei wei...

LUicQmtpgkTxIrRNwaTkuQ.text: I know that it is Asian fast food, but it is just too sweet for me.  There are too many other more authentic Asian fast food restaurants in the area for me to bother coming back here.  And if I am specifically craving American-style Asian food, then I would probably go down the street to Tott's.

TUL2uQ6c2-JC43gwv0iQ5w.text: I know I might some flack for only giving this place 3 stars, but really....it's no different than Chang's.  If I could give half stars, I would give it a 3.5.  Why?  Because I think it's better than Chang's.  It's exactly the same menu (just not as diverse), but cheaper.  If you are at this location, try Tott's instead.  I bet you'll start going there more often than here.

4SvuCVEG92lJSNjUkfJMNA.text: Great food, & friendly service. I've tried several of their dishes, but prefer the lo-mein category; the children's lo-mein is actually quite good. Not sure why pei wei gets negative ratings, but I enjoy this place as much as I do Tott's Asian Diner. Both are great places to eat at. It'd be nice if pei wei had listed open/closed hours though.

qit8pV5Cyn_BXVMMxlMCAQ.text: this was my first visit to pei wei and i enjoyed it but felt it was just ok. i had the japanese chili ramen with tofu and a veggie spring roll. the spring roll was fairly bland and greasy. the ramen was good and i've got leftovers for tomorrow. honestly, i'd rather go to yc's if i want bbq but i'll probably try it again and actually get a meat dish

8uYsHA6cg4ob8KPqH_5alw.text: Great fresh made to order food. Nothing prepared in advance.  Dow side is it is somewhat corporate sterile environment and a little over priced for chinese food eith smallish portions. But it is good.

iJvUxgbjJYXspTObgNsSoA.text: totts asian diner in the same complex kicks their ass any day of the week. i think i'm just not a pei wei person. it's like PF Chang's sister....on welfare.

wRfZHexzxTdVN8TA0W9m8g.text: not bad. i like that you can order online and set up the time you want to pick up your food. i had the thai coconut curry and pot stickers. the food was good. obviously its not the most authentic but do you really expect authentic at a place like this? not really. all in all i'm a fan. i'll be back.

qBzqo3ShVC1gYVLrQ717gA.text: We haven't been back to Pei Wei in a while since they made some serious menu changes and things seemed to have gone down hill. Today it was more out of convenience than anything else that I actually went back.  The staff were friendly enough and I placed my order very quickly, but since it was before the typical lunch rush would begin there were very few of us in the place. The things I noticed though before my lunch arrived began to trouble me. First was the doors to the restrooms, they were filthy! The restrooms themselves were clean enough, but the doors looked like they were from an old service station; covered with greasy dirt on both sides.  Once I sat down and began looking about the dining area, which appeared clean at first glance, began to show it's True state. Carpets that were badly in need of a "bisselling", spots under the tables that showed that the tables had not been moved when the floors were cleaned, the stainless steel was a mess and the soda machines were an absolute disgrace. When I went to take a bottle of soy sauce off of the shelf all of the bottles were filthy and actually stuck to the shelf!  In the same line the wood work and the window sills had not been dusted in a very long time. and the more I looked about me the more details I came across that should have been taken care of by an observant staff.  When I told the manager of some of my observations he did in fact take all of the soy bottles into the back to be cleaned and he came out and cleaned the shelf himself. A good first step actually.  All that being said the food was pretty good, which was really a surprise. And that's a good sign too.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Tempe, AZ, United States. From the window sill next to my table.
Photo of Pei Wei - Tempe, AZ, United States. Under the soda machines, egads!

sAdLMg7o-j6Xwx8Ya0HxkQ.text: Terrible. This place has just gone down hill. Went to pick up some take out and came home and literally my meal was rice and chicken.  No sauce. No flavor. Nothing. It was like they had forgotten to do anything. I called back in and had to drive 15 minutes back to get another order and it was only marginally better.

ZtGquPikokMsghU1sR0lkQ.text: This restaurant has definitely gone down hill over the last year or so. We ate here over the weekend. First, they were understaffed. Only one person taking orders and one person delivering food to tables and cleaning up the tables. There wasn't one table clean inside. When I told the order taker, he suggested I just go outside! I looked on the patio, and all the tables outside were also dirty. There were at least 8 tables with dishes left on them and the rest were not wiped off. I asked to have a table wiped off. She did a quick job and left crumbs on the table and in the chairs. The bathroom was also in need of attention. One of the toilets was terribly backed up. The silverware on the counter was dirty, all the forks had rice on them!  We elected to use plastic. Not a good experience and our last time to eat here.

eYeUVc_a_Pzwt30yT71seg.text: The Guadalupe store I have reviewed in the past was my favorite because of one of their staff.  I haven't seen that staffer in a while.  This time the staffer that stands out is Zachary.  I dare you to find a more professional, efficient and pleasant person.  His intelligence really shows when you place your order with him.  Believe me, compared to the person I placed my Bento order with here today (which somehow got from its list price of $9.99 to $20.95!) Zachary would have never made any of the errors that person made and you wouldn't have had to repeat "for here" 3 times!  Any service oriented business would do very well with people like Zachary on board.

aOQg1EZDtBOCsCJvD3o8ng.text: Good food. Slow service at this particular location, at least the day I visited. They were out of a lot of things, including silverware, napkins, and ice, which seemed strange with less than five customers inside. However, the spicy mango plate was on-point though.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Tempe, AZ, United States. Highly recommended (spicy mango)

3wEEV4ovXT2MWp9JLUIi0Q.text: I ordered sweet and sour chicken with white rice. Also a pork veggie egg roll. And crab wontons. The chicken, veggies and rice were good. But BUT the sweet and sour sauce was NOT sweet and sour. Disappointed. The crab wontons didn't have enough cream cheese and crab flavor. The roll was.... too much.... pork. Everything would have tasted better with better sweet and sour sauce. I will come back to try something else though. Different sauce. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Tempe, AZ, United States

7Fca4UyMm2USRMjVlfXy9A.text: This use to be my go to Pei Wei, I live roughly about the same distance between 3. But after tonight I don't think I can ever go back. My last visit they forgot the lettuce with the lettuce wraps. Not the worst mistake. But today was pretty bad.  I placed an online order and waiting close to an hour with insurance that my order was next. With order after order going out and other people having the same problem. By the hour make I had no option to just ask for a refund along with half the other pissed off people that got told the same thing. Do you're a favor. If you don't want to waste your time. Drive a little bit further for a different Pei Wei.

JjVhcV5T73lnH7YhBCJ5ag.text: This place has gone downhill. The food is still pretty decent when they get it right. The staff has no clue what they are doing, or even how their food is supposed to be prepared. The management is nonexistent and have not properly trainied front line staff.  We ordered two entrees and an edamame. One entree and the edamame was incorrect and the adolescent staff working had no clue how to fix it. I didnt see anyone resembling a manager on the floor to ask for help so i waited until they made it correctly. In the span of 5 minutes they messed up our order, forgot the sauce for the appetizers next to us that the lady requested 3 times, and never made an online order that someone came to pick up. Need better management presence, or at least a manager presence. Wont be back for awhile if at all.

2KByy3_peBOOYicbKJJLHQ.text: Waited 40 mins for food. Said they forgot and skipped my orders. Girl new orange chicken. Sad and bland

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sad orange chicken

SzOnxx63fWBp6jAs4NTJqg.text: Ok. This was my go to Pei Wei for a number of years. We would eat here every Sunday. The last three or four months it's gotten worse and worse. I've waited 30 to 45 minutes for an order that I placed online. I received Orange Chicken with Veggies with no Veggies. I received food with no sauce.  So we've been going to Casa Paloma Pei Wei and it's been worlds worlds better. Today however I was shopping in the same area and decided to try this location again. I placed my order online for a Bento Box for pickup. When I got there only one person was working both counters so I waited about 5 minutes. My food was ready though so that was good. Once waited on, the girl counted my money wrong and proceeded to give me 9.99 back and she thought I was a penny short. Whatever.  She could have asked me if I had more change. Then got home to eat.  Rolls didn't taste fresh. Miso salad had no dressing. Wonton had no sauce. Chicken had two good size pieces and then a bunch of tiny tiny fried hard pieces. Also there was some black stringy thing in my chicken.  NEVER AGAIN.   It's sad because this location used to be very good.

CJ3v5En9MWl_HSvo5Xc19Q.text: I have mixed emotions about this place. I came in a belt 4 days ago with my boyfriend. I ordered the chicken lettuce wraps with a cup of , wonton soup and he ordered the orange fried shrimp with rice I believe.   OMG LET ME tell you the chicken lettuce wraps are absolutely phenomenal literally every single bite was mouth watering. A really nice soy sauce salty flavor with white meat chicken, mushrooms, water chestnuts, scallions and , garlic sever with this crispy stuff with nicly cut lettues perfect for scooping the yummy delicious chicken. The wonton soup was just equally good nice and savory broth.   This is were thing changed. I came back yestarday and decided to try something new on the menu. I went with the chicken Thai mango at the recommendation of the woman who took my order. I asked for it to be extra spicy I also ordered the crab lagoons and the hot and sour soup with a glass of wine.   I sat at the bar area. The whole entire time I was there I was not greeted by one employee. Nobody asked how it was doing if I was enjoying my food or if I needed anything. In fact I had to flag the waiters down multiple times. Once for napkins the second time for silverware and the third time to get a glass of water.   I did not enjoy the thia mango whatsoever.  The chunks of meat are absolutely huge way too big. The whole entire dish was drowning in peanuts I pulled out at least 45. The veggies were not soft at all they're very hard. And this sause was not spicy at all.   I only eat a few bites. The lettuce that I got was absolutely horrible it look like they just ripped a patch off it off it was so mangled that I couldn't even eat it as a wrap which is very disappointing.   The crab lagoons on the other side where the highlight of my meal they had a very generous amount of crap and the yummy sweet topped it off. I also had the hot and sour soup which was good had a nice thick consistency.  I feel like for spending $21 the customer service was not up to par nor the food/ particular  menu item i ordered.  I would consider coming back but I'll probably only get  lettuce wraps I'm scared to try something different and not like it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chunk of lettuce they ripped off calling it wraps
Photo of Pei Wei - Tempe, AZ, United States. Hot and sour soup. A nice and thick consistency
Photo of Pei Wei - Tempe, AZ, United States. Thai mango with chicken with lettuce wraps definitely wouldn&#39;t order again. Lacking flavor drowning in peanuts unedible lettuce wraps.

u5jvm35DuhZd71fFAhpLSg.text: Not good. Food came out wrong then waited 20 minutes for the replacement even though it was ready and on the counter. Because according to the cook only one specific person can deliver it to the table, even though the counter was 5 steps away. Worst experience.

JSBA19j9NwmdUZzspTByrg.text: Way down hill.   Mucky slop salt sauce, over cooked veggies, beef jerky chewy steak.  Three employees had quit that week, we were told.  Feeling sick.  Place was empty, besides people waiting 45 minutes for carry out.  Horrible waste of time and money. Won't be back.

4FyyepbbScYPA_XgogL87Q.text: Horrible management at this location. I've given them many chances and the last 4 times I've been there they have told me verbally over the phone that my order would be ready in only 12 minutes. Every time I go, it's actually about 45 min wait. Why tell me 12 minutes when you are backed up with 20+ online orders and only 2 people working?

Z7zSsTBmp7PcmAr0mXEv0g.text: Warning: you will get hit in the face by flying rice and you won't know where it came from!!! Food was okay service was ehh okay too. Pretty average I guess. My food was labeled spicy but not spicy and I got hit in the face by some random rice but I can't really complain about free food when it hits my face and falls into my plate. Life is okay

N4vqkcejf8_W6YGOZrGPVA.text: Pei wei is cool. Use to go there a lot. Not so much lately. One time we went there it was really bad. I figure I would give it another go because it was on the way home and I didn't feel like cooking. I was watching the commercial and fell for the hype. I realized that I'm not a fan of the wei better orange chicken. I think they should call it wei more rice. I should make my wei to Trader Joe's and get their orange chicken. It's wei better and I'm wei fuller after I eat it.

bTP97HtBc_CRLSCBupml4g.text: This location is so inconsistent! I LOVE Pad Thai and it never tastes the same anytime I order. It's a 50/50 shot that it may taste good. Today, it had hardly any sauce, no cilantro--which makes the flavor pop-- and the noodles are so mushy! When you're spending that much on an entree, it makes me want to start looking for a new place to go! Certainly disappointed as I was really craving this for lunch.

Y_pUnFDTXU2m2vkT0-0iuQ.text: Terrible service and over salted food.I waited over 25 minutes to get spring rolls and a kids teriyaki chicken won't be coming back

WFH4pj1CeBZreyiE8MlWcQ.text: I've only ever gone to a Pei Wei twice and I regret both times. I went once about a year ago and didn't enjoy the food but decided to try it again tonight and it was even worse. I got a the mango California roll which would've been good if it didn't taste like it had been sitting out all night. The rice was hard and definitely didn't have a fresh taste. The next thing I got was the chicken pad Thai. Firstly I was not expecting tofu in this considering it's chicken but that was my fault for not asking the ingredients. After picking out all the tofu and tasting the dish I was deeply disappointed. There was almost NO FLAVOR! The most I got was lime juice from the lime I squeezed on top. No spice no sauce flavor. It was bland and not worth the money. I couldn't take more than 5 bites before giving up on it. Not happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Pei Wei - Tempe, AZ, United States

wdf0BY_VZ5WWkV7bDlYkDQ.text: I ordered a salad and 2 sushi rolls online for pickup. When I went to pick up the order, I was handed the order and told that it was all set. The sushi rolls were missing from the order. When I asked, she said that they ran out. She said that she was new and it was busy, to go online and submit a comment.   Turns out that you can not submit a comment on their site, you are told to contact the store. I contacted the manager the next day and was told that there was nothing they could do. I just had the charge post and i'm submitting a charge back.   They should have contacted me about the missing items or told me when I went to pick up the order. They least they could have done is offered some kind of compensation, instead they charged me for items they could not provide.

icTSDktA-SkYM3zNPvZ-1g.text: I love Pei Wei. The food is delicious. The service is usually super fast. Only problem we had today was a stray piece of chicken in my vegetarian daughter's lunch... Oh oh!  Overall they have a lot of tasty options for carnivores and veg-heads alike. And you can order any of their menu options with vegetables and tofu, and I have to say, the way they prepare tofu is my favorite!  For relatively "fast" food, Pei Wei is an excellent option for delicious and healthy dining out.

8UyT40sVKlFHgWX_a6RR9g.text: I really like pei wei, even if they do have teeny-boppers manning the registers that overuse "like" and "um, ok".  I usually get the edamame and salad rolls, this is branching out for me.  my old favorite was the pad thai, no tofu, extra beef, extra spicy; with a side of crab puffs.  i am also a HUGE fan of their hot mustard.  service is usually expedient. it's not a big restaurant and can get a bit crowded.

i_7Wiu-jV8uigg-F3hkwnA.text: Pei Wei No Way  The price is cheaper than P.F Chang for sure. But the amount is so small, just enough for my Yorkie. The meat is dry; no sauce. Hot & Sour soup is more like Hot & Salty soup.   Because I've never been to other Pei Wei, this 2 stars rating is only for Guadapupe location Diner Select dishes. the price range for their Dinner Select is $6.25 to $7,  you can get same price & better taste even at many other Chinese Buffet, like Hunan 8 in Mesa (Gilber/60),lunch & dinner same price exclude Sunday,  or Yummy Buffet in Chandler for lunch (Alma/Walner). or Lin's buffet, $8 lunch, you can get salmon; deep fry shrimp.  I do agree it is cleaner & not as noisy as most of Asian restaurant.

-RAC_nf5SzUqQtwreOPodg.text: Been here many times before but its been awhile. Decided to go tonight and literally expected G. Ramsey to walk out at any moment and shut the place down. Seriously, it was complete chaos. They changed the menu. The guy taking the order kept walking off to check things. There was no ice or clean silver wear. The appetizer came out and was only warm and wasn't as good as usual. You could hear and see customers complaining and getting refunds all over the place. The staff all seemed confused. My entree finally came out, also not hot, but my girlfriends didn't show up for another 10 minutes.  All during this they kept going to the wrong tables with food and looking confused.  It was crazy, finally gave up, got a refund from the manager and went next door for dinner.  I won't be returning here again.

m80gYJttc0v_lQW-frGGIw.text: I really like Pei Wei.  But you have to understand what it is.  It is a chain.  It is not quite fast food, but not quite a restaurant.  It is rarely great, but almost never bad.  It's consistent, like most chains are.  The crab wontons are tasty, and I love the sweet chili sauce that they come with.    Mongolian Beef, Honey Seared Shrimp are a couple of our go-tos.  There are much better Chinese/Asian restaurants in the world.  There are also quite a few worse.  Like I said, it is consistent and reliable - and sometimes that's all I need.  I rarely crave Pei Wei specifically, but I would never turn it down.

jgrmFDWKP8eUTEZZ0iMq2g.text: There's some Pei Wei hating going on here, but I think I like their food better than PF Chang's. It's definitely less salty if nothing else! I got the lettuce chicken wraps, the PW Spicy chicken and the beef green curry with brown rice. Everything was good---just like you would get at an above average chain restaurant. I got the take out, and the hostess was really polite--she took the time to ask if I wanted condiments or utensils. I am mentioning that because it happened to be 31st Dec night, and the place was pretty packed. I actually quite liked the beef green curry! Think I'll add this place to my list of go-to restaurants for when I am craving Chinese fast food, and don't want to shell out $$ for PF Chang-like fare.

61LX4t_LBGvy00fWB27DWg.text: Okay, so I might be a total weirdo, but I wake up craving Pei Wei's fried rice some days.  There is very little I enjoy more than waking up hungry at 10 AM on one of my days off, logging on to Pei Wei's website, and ordering fried rice just the way I like it without having to explain it to anyone and risk them writing it down wrong.  I'm antisocial, so what?  Then, I know that when they open at 11 AM they will have my very special order of fried rice hot and ready waiting for me.  The portions are huge, so a $6-$7 order of fried rice can last me up to four meals, which is an awesome [if not exactly healthy] deal.    I don't really like much of their other food that I've tried.  There's some sort of curry dish that was nice, but I'm sticking to my fried rice with extra egg...  yum.

IPxGtHVe6syPfTtzXLT-6Q.text: This place gets so much hype and so many people always suggest it for meals, but after hearing awful stories about roaches and hair I was reluctant to go back.   Thankfully, my meal was insect and hair free, but there was absolutely nothing memorable about it. I had the crab won-tons which were virtually tasteless.. My Pad Thai the same, I had to load it up with lime and rooster sauce for there to be anything to wrap my tongue around. However, my friend had the Mandarin Kung Pao, and it was yummy. I ate more of that than my own meal. To me it is just quick chain food that I could easily buy in a frozen package and throw in my wok for about half the price. One thing I will say is that their staff is eerily friendly, and I don't know if it was my extremely enormous Asian inspired tattoo that they were mesmerized by, but I was asked how I was doing at least 10 times, by several different dining room attendants.. Ill give them that, and their orange tea.. I could drink that for days.

E_Cej6esKIUvZSRvglAWOg.text: I can't understand why anyone would eat here.  I've been there 3 times and simply put this place is awful.  The potstickers are tasteless, but that is better than any of the noodle dishes.  Those noddles taste as if they were made from wallpaper glue.    Totts Asian diner is right there and sooooo much better.  Yuphia thai is down the street as well.  Both are much better choices.

uxn0TWa92OPkkWh_8gSdgg.text: I am a regular at Pei Wei, and I get the same thing every time. I don't care for chicken, so I get a side of the lo mein noodles with lo mein sauce without chicken. It costs a whopping $1.95 and totally fills me up! I also love their edamame and crab wontons. Sooo yummy!
